summary: Email correspondence between attorney Gloria Allred and an Assistant United States Attorney regarding a new alleged victim of Jeffrey Epstein who is willing to attend a victim meeting in New York on October 23, 2019. The email discusses logistics coordination with the FBI's victim services.

persons.name: Gloria Allred
persons.context: Attorney who emails an Assistant United States Attorney to inform them of a new client who is an alleged victim of Jeffrey Epstein, willing to travel for a victim meeting.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referred to as 'E' in the subject line and explicitly named as the perpetrator whose alleged victim is the subject of the correspondence.

connections.description: Allred is representing a client who is an alleged victim of Epstein, indicating an attorney-client relationship related to Epstein's alleged crimes.

events.title: Victim meeting in New York
events.description: A meeting for victims of Jeffrey Epstein, organized by the FBI, requiring travel coordination for attendees.

locations: 1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
6300 Wilshire Blvd., Suite 1500, Los Angeles, CA 90048
keyFacts: A new alleged victim of Jeffrey Epstein came forward and was represented by attorney Gloria Allred in October 2019.
The victim was willing to fly to New York for an FBI-organized victim meeting scheduled for October 23, 2019.
The Assistant United States Attorney from the Southern District of New York was coordinating with the FBI's victim services for travel logistics.
The correspondence indicates ongoing victim outreach and coordination by law enforcement following Epstein's arrest and death.
